text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Supreme Council of Exports decides after meeting headed by Mubarak to set up special airlines to carry freight and to privatise navigation companies to encourage exports. President asks council to remove obstacles that impede Egyptian exports.
- Mubarak to hold talks with King Hussein in Jordan tomorrow and to meet Netanyahu in Sharm el-Sheikh on Tuesday.
- Moussa and Arafat discussed ways to save peace process. Foreign minister says all ideas are based on dealing with settlements issue.
- Allbright says Egypt plays very imporatant role in peace process.
- Egypt recognises new government in Democratic Republic of Congo.
- European Union cancels duties on Egyptian textiles.
- Parliament to decide on new budget on Wednesday.
